2025-08-10 13:25:59
Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import json import time import os from datetime import datetime print('=== MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH: WIL G. PANSTERS & ARIJ OUWENEEL (FINAL FIX) ===') print('Objective: Find articles about Mexican rural history by the editors of the 1992 UCSD publication') print('Target Authors: Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel') print('Focus: Academic articles, journal publications, book chapters on rural Mexican historical topics') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both authors and Mexican rural history search_queries = [ # Wil G. Pansters focused searches 'Wil G. Pansters Mexican rural history article', '"Wil G. Pansters" rural Mexico history publication', 'Pansters rural Mexico peasants agriculture history', 'Wil Pansters Mexico countryside rural development history', '"Wil G. Pansters" Mexican agrarian history journal article', # Arij Ouweneel focused searches 'Arij Ouweneel Mexican rural history publication', '"Arij Ouweneel" rural Mexico history article', 'Ouweneel rural history Mexico peasants agriculture', 'Arij Ouweneel Mexico countryside rural development', '"Arij Ouweneel" Mexican agrarian history journal', # Combined and broader searches 'Pansters Ouweneel Mexican rural history editors', '"Region State Capitalism Mexico" editors rural history articles', 'Wil Pansters Arij Ouweneel rural Mexico publications', 'Mexican rural history Pansters Ouweneel academic articles', 'Center U.S.-Mexican Studies editors rural history publications' ] print(f'Total search queries planned: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch Strategy:') print('1. Target both authors individually with rural history keywords') print('2. Use exact name matching with quotes for precision') print('3. Include related terms: peasants, agriculture, agrarian, countryside') print('4. Cross-reference with their editorial work') print('5. Focus on academic publications and journal articles') print('\n' + '=' * 80) # Store all search results with detailed analysis all_results = [] results_by_author = { 'wil_pansters': [], 'arij_ouweneel': [], 'both_authors': [], 'related_publications': [] } # Execute comprehensive searches for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\n[SEARCH {i}/{len(search_queries)}] {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Perform search with multiple backends for comprehensive coverage results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): # Extract result data with safe defaults title = result.get('title', 'No title') body = result.get('body', 'No description') href = result.get('href', 'No URL') print(f'\nResult {j}:') print(f'Title: {title}') print(f'Description: {body}') print(f'URL: {href}') # FINAL FIX: Define combined_text RIGHT HERE, immediately after data extraction combined_text = f'{str(title).lower()} {str(body).lower()}' print(f'DEBUG: combined_text created successfully') # Check for author names has_pansters = any(term in combined_text for term in ['pansters', 'wil g. pansters', 'wil pansters']) has_ouweneel = any(term in combined_text for term in ['ouweneel', 'arij ouweneel']) # Check for rural history indicators rural_indicators = [ 'rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'peasants', 'agrarian', 'agriculture', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'ejido', 'campesino', 'campesinos', 'land reform', 'rural development', 'rural society', 'rural economy', 'agricultural history' ] found_rural_terms = [term for term in rural_indicators if term in combined_text] # Check for Mexican/Mexico context has_mexico_context = any(term in combined_text for term in ['mexico', 'mexican', 'm√©xico']) # Check for academic publication indicators academic_indicators = [ 'journal', 'article', 'publication', 'paper', 'chapter', 'book', 'study', 'research', 'academic', 'university', 'press', 'published', 'author' ] found_academic_terms = [term for term in academic_indicators if term in combined_text] # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 if has_pansters: relevance_score += 3 if has_ouweneel: relevance_score += 3 if found_rural_terms: relevance_score += len(found_rural_terms) if has_mexico_context: relevance_score += 2 if found_academic_terms: relevance_score += len(found_academic_terms) # Categorize results categories = [] if has_pansters and not has_ouweneel: categories.append('Wil Pansters') results_by_author['wil_pansters'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) elif has_ouweneel and not has_pansters: categories.append('Arij Ouweneel') results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) elif has_pansters and has_ouweneel: categories.append('Both Authors') results_by_author['both_authors'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) elif found_rural_terms and has_mexico_context and found_academic_terms: categories.append('Related Publication') results_by_author['related_publications'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Display analysis results if categories: print(f'üéØ RELEVANT: {", ".join(categories)} (Score: {relevance_score})') if found_rural_terms: print(f' Rural terms: {found_rural_terms}') if found_academic_terms: print(f' Academic terms: {found_academic_terms[:5]}') # Show first 5 if has_mexico_context: print(f' ‚úì Mexican context confirmed') else: print(f' Low relevance (Score: {relevance_score})') print('-' * 40) # Store comprehensive result data all_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'has_pansters': has_pansters, 'has_ouweneel': has_ouweneel, 'has_mexico_context': has_mexico_context, 'rural_terms_found': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms_found': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'categories': categories }) else: print('No results found for this query') except Exception as e: print(f'Error during search {i}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() # Brief pause between searches to avoid rate limiting time.sleep(1) print('=' * 80) # Generate comprehensive analysis print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH ANALYSIS ===') total_results = len(all_results) print(f'Total search queries executed: {len(search_queries)}') print(f'Total results collected: {total_results}') # Analyze results by author print('\n--- RESULTS BY AUTHOR ---') print(f'Wil G. Pansters results: {len(results_by_author["wil_pansters"])}') print(f'Arij Ouweneel results: {len(results_by_author["arij_ouweneel"])}') print(f'Both authors mentioned: {len(results_by_author["both_authors"])}') print(f'Related publications: {len(results_by_author["related_publications"])}') # Identify top findings for each author print('\n=== TOP FINDINGS BY AUTHOR ===') # Wil G. Pansters top findings if results_by_author['wil_pansters']: print('\nüìö WIL G. PANSTERS - TOP RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATIONS:') pansters_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['wil_pansters'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(pansters_sorted[:5], 1): # Top 5 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Source query: {result["query"]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific results found for Wil G. Pansters rural history articles') # Arij Ouweneel top findings if results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']: print('\nüìö ARIJ OUWENEEL - TOP RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATIONS:') ouweneel_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(ouweneel_sorted[:5], 1): # Top 5 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Source query: {result["query"]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific results found for Arij Ouweneel rural history articles') # Combined findings if results_by_author['both_authors']: print('\nüìö COLLABORATIVE OR COMPARATIVE WORKS:') both_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['both_authors'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(both_sorted[:3], 1): # Top 3 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') # Save comprehensive research data research_data = { 'research_objective': 'Find Mexican rural history articles by Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel', 'target_authors': { 'primary': 'Wil G. Pansters', 'secondary': 'Arij Ouweneel', 'context': 'Editors of 1992 Center for U.S.-Mexican Studies publication "Region, State and Capitalism in Mexico"' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': total_results, 'queries_executed': search_queries }, 'results_by_category': results_by_author, 'all_results': all_results, 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } # Save detailed results detailed_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json' with open(detailed_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) # Save summary report summary_report = { 'research_title': 'Mexican Rural History Articles by Pansters and Ouweneel', 'research_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d'), 'authors_researched': ['Wil G. Pansters', 'Arij Ouweneel'], 'search_results_summary': { 'wil_pansters_articles': len(results_by_author['wil_pansters']), 'arij_ouweneel_articles': len(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']), 'collaborative_works': len(results_by_author['both_authors']), 'related_publications': len(results_by_author['related_publications']) }, 'top_findings': { 'pansters_top_3': sorted(results_by_author['wil_pansters'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True)[:3], 'ouweneel_top_3': sorted(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True)[:3] }, 'research_notes': [ 'Searched for academic articles specifically on Mexican rural history topics', 'Focused on journal publications, book chapters, and academic papers', 'Used comprehensive keyword combinations including rural, agrarian, peasant terms', 'Cross-referenced with their known editorial work on Mexican regional studies' ] } summary_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_research_summary.json' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(summary_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n=== RESEARCH DATA SAVED ===') print(f'Detailed results: {detailed_file}') print(f'Summary report: {summary_file}') # Final summary print(f'\n=== FINAL RESEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(f'‚úì Executed {len(search_queries)} comprehensive searches') print(f'‚úì Collected {total_results} total results') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(results_by_author["wil_pansters"])} Wil G. Pansters publications') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(results_by_author["arij_ouweneel"])} Arij Ouweneel publications') print(f'‚úì Found {len(results_by_author["both_authors"])} collaborative/comparative works') print(f'‚úì Located {len(results_by_author["related_publications"])} related rural history publications') if results_by_author['wil_pansters'] or results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']: print('\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found specific rural history publications by target authors') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Few specific publications found - may need targeted database searches') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review detailed results for specific publication dates and venues') print('2. Cross-reference findings with academic databases (JSTOR, Project MUSE)') print('3. Examine university repository and author CV pages') print('4. Verify publication details and citation information') print('5. Compile final bibliography of rural history articles by both authors') print('\n*** MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH COMPLETE ***')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code still encounters the same critical NameError: 'combined_text' is not defined despite multiple attempted fixes. The error occurs consistently during the analysis phase of each search query, preventing any meaningful processing of the retrieved data. While the searches are successfully executing and finding highly relevant results (including 'Regional Mexican history: Treasury or Pandora's Box?', Wil G. Pansters' Utrecht University publications page, JSTOR articles by Arij Ouweneel on agrarian cycles, and references to their collaborative 'Region State Capitalism Mexico' work), the code crashes before analyzing any content. This results in 0 processed results despite collecting valuable search data that directly addresses the **PLAN** requirements. The variable scoping issue persists - there appears to be a fundamental problem with how 'combined_text' is being defined within the loop structure. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no rural history articles were successfully identified due to the persistent coding error, though the raw search results show excellent potential matches. Recommended fix: Completely restructure the result processing loop to ensure 'combined_text' is properly scoped - define it immediately after extracting title, body, href variables and before any analysis logic that references it.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import json import time import os from datetime import datetime print('=== MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH: WIL G. PANSTERS & ARIJ OUWENEEL (FINAL FIX) ===') print('Objective: Find articles about Mexican rural history by the editors of the 1992 UCSD publication') print('Target Authors: Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel') print('Focus: Academic articles, journal publications, book chapters on rural Mexican historical topics') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both authors and Mexican rural history search_queries = [ # Wil G. Pansters focused searches 'Wil G. Pansters Mexican rural history article', '"Wil G. Pansters" rural Mexico history publication', 'Pansters rural Mexico peasants agriculture history', 'Wil Pansters Mexico countryside rural development history', '"Wil G. Pansters" Mexican agrarian history journal article', # Arij Ouweneel focused searches 'Arij Ouweneel Mexican rural history publication', '"Arij Ouweneel" rural Mexico history article', 'Ouweneel rural history Mexico peasants agriculture', 'Arij Ouweneel Mexico countryside rural development', '"Arij Ouweneel" Mexican agrarian history journal', # Combined and broader searches 'Pansters Ouweneel Mexican rural history editors', '"Region State Capitalism Mexico" editors rural history articles', 'Wil Pansters Arij Ouweneel rural Mexico publications', 'Mexican rural history Pansters Ouweneel academic articles', 'Center U.S.-Mexican Studies editors rural history publications' ] print(f'Total search queries planned: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch Strategy:') print('1. Target both authors individually with rural history keywords') print('2. Use exact name matching with quotes for precision') print('3. Include related terms: peasants, agriculture, agrarian, countryside') print('4. Cross-reference with their editorial work') print('5. Focus on academic publications and journal articles') print('\n' + '=' * 80) # Store all search results with detailed analysis all_results = [] results_by_author = { 'wil_pansters': [], 'arij_ouweneel': [], 'both_authors': [], 'related_publications': [] } # Execute comprehensive searches for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\n[SEARCH {i}/{len(search_queries)}] {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Perform search with multiple backends for comprehensive coverage results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): # Extract result data with safe defaults title = result.get('title', 'No title') body = result.get('body', 'No description') href = result.get('href', 'No URL') print(f'\nResult {j}:') print(f'Title: {title}') print(f'Description: {body}') print(f'URL: {href}') # FINAL FIX: Define combined_text RIGHT HERE, immediately after data extraction combined_text = f'{str(title).lower()} {str(body).lower()}' print(f'DEBUG: combined_text created successfully') # Check for author names has_pansters = any(term in combined_text for term in ['pansters', 'wil g. pansters', 'wil pansters']) has_ouweneel = any(term in combined_text for term in ['ouweneel', 'arij ouweneel']) # Check for rural history indicators rural_indicators = [ 'rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'peasants', 'agrarian', 'agriculture', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'ejido', 'campesino', 'campesinos', 'land reform', 'rural development', 'rural society', 'rural economy', 'agricultural history' ] found_rural_terms = [term for term in rural_indicators if term in combined_text] # Check for Mexican/Mexico context has_mexico_context = any(term in combined_text for term in ['mexico', 'mexican', 'm√©xico']) # Check for academic publication indicators academic_indicators = [ 'journal', 'article', 'publication', 'paper', 'chapter', 'book', 'study', 'research', 'academic', 'university', 'press', 'published', 'author' ] found_academic_terms = [term for term in academic_indicators if term in combined_text] # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 if has_pansters: relevance_score += 3 if has_ouweneel: relevance_score += 3 if found_rural_terms: relevance_score += len(found_rural_terms) if has_mexico_context: relevance_score += 2 if found_academic_terms: relevance_score += len(found_academic_terms) # Categorize results categories = [] if has_pansters and not has_ouweneel: categories.append('Wil Pansters') results_by_author['wil_pansters'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) elif has_ouweneel and not has_pansters: categories.append('Arij Ouweneel') results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) elif has_pansters and has_ouweneel: categories.append('Both Authors') results_by_author['both_authors'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) elif found_rural_terms and has_mexico_context and found_academic_terms: categories.append('Related Publication') results_by_author['related_publications'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Display analysis results if categories: print(f'üéØ RELEVANT: {", ".join(categories)} (Score: {relevance_score})') if found_rural_terms: print(f' Rural terms: {found_rural_terms}') if found_academic_terms: print(f' Academic terms: {found_academic_terms[:5]}') # Show first 5 if has_mexico_context: print(f' ‚úì Mexican context confirmed') else: print(f' Low relevance (Score: {relevance_score})') print('-' * 40) # Store comprehensive result data all_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'has_pansters': has_pansters, 'has_ouweneel': has_ouweneel, 'has_mexico_context': has_mexico_context, 'rural_terms_found': found_rural_terms, 'academic_terms_found': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'categories': categories }) else: print('No results found for this query') except Exception as e: print(f'Error during search {i}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() # Brief pause between searches to avoid rate limiting time.sleep(1) print('=' * 80) # Generate comprehensive analysis print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH ANALYSIS ===') total_results = len(all_results) print(f'Total search queries executed: {len(search_queries)}') print(f'Total results collected: {total_results}') # Analyze results by author print('\n--- RESULTS BY AUTHOR ---') print(f'Wil G. Pansters results: {len(results_by_author["wil_pansters"])}') print(f'Arij Ouweneel results: {len(results_by_author["arij_ouweneel"])}') print(f'Both authors mentioned: {len(results_by_author["both_authors"])}') print(f'Related publications: {len(results_by_author["related_publications"])}') # Identify top findings for each author print('\n=== TOP FINDINGS BY AUTHOR ===') # Wil G. Pansters top findings if results_by_author['wil_pansters']: print('\nüìö WIL G. PANSTERS - TOP RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATIONS:') pansters_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['wil_pansters'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(pansters_sorted[:5], 1): # Top 5 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Source query: {result["query"]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific results found for Wil G. Pansters rural history articles') # Arij Ouweneel top findings if results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']: print('\nüìö ARIJ OUWENEEL - TOP RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATIONS:') ouweneel_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(ouweneel_sorted[:5], 1): # Top 5 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Source query: {result["query"]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific results found for Arij Ouweneel rural history articles') # Combined findings if results_by_author['both_authors']: print('\nüìö COLLABORATIVE OR COMPARATIVE WORKS:') both_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['both_authors'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(both_sorted[:3], 1): # Top 3 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') # Save comprehensive research data research_data = { 'research_objective': 'Find Mexican rural history articles by Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel', 'target_authors': { 'primary': 'Wil G. Pansters', 'secondary': 'Arij Ouweneel', 'context': 'Editors of 1992 Center for U.S.-Mexican Studies publication "Region, State and Capitalism in Mexico"' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': total_results, 'queries_executed': search_queries }, 'results_by_category': results_by_author, 'all_results': all_results, 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } # Save detailed results detailed_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json' with open(detailed_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) # Save summary report summary_report = { 'research_title': 'Mexican Rural History Articles by Pansters and Ouweneel', 'research_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d'), 'authors_researched': ['Wil G. Pansters', 'Arij Ouweneel'], 'search_results_summary': { 'wil_pansters_articles': len(results_by_author['wil_pansters']), 'arij_ouweneel_articles': len(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']), 'collaborative_works': len(results_by_author['both_authors']), 'related_publications': len(results_by_author['related_publications']) }, 'top_findings': { 'pansters_top_3': sorted(results_by_author['wil_pansters'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True)[:3], 'ouweneel_top_3': sorted(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True)[:3] }, 'research_notes': [ 'Searched for academic articles specifically on Mexican rural history topics', 'Focused on journal publications, book chapters, and academic papers', 'Used comprehensive keyword combinations including rural, agrarian, peasant terms', 'Cross-referenced with their known editorial work on Mexican regional studies' ] } summary_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_research_summary.json' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(summary_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n=== RESEARCH DATA SAVED ===') print(f'Detailed results: {detailed_file}') print(f'Summary report: {summary_file}') # Final summary print(f'\n=== FINAL RESEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(f'‚úì Executed {len(search_queries)} comprehensive searches') print(f'‚úì Collected {total_results} total results') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(results_by_author["wil_pansters"])} Wil G. Pansters publications') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(results_by_author["arij_ouweneel"])} Arij Ouweneel publications') print(f'‚úì Found {len(results_by_author["both_authors"])} collaborative/comparative works') print(f'‚úì Located {len(results_by_author["related_publications"])} related rural history publications') if results_by_author['wil_pansters'] or results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']: print('\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found specific rural history publications by target authors') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Few specific publications found - may need targeted database searches') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review detailed results for specific publication dates and venues') print('2. Cross-reference findings with academic databases (JSTOR, Project MUSE)') print('3. Examine university repository and author CV pages') print('4. Verify publication details and citation information') print('5. Compile final bibliography of rural history articles by both authors') print('\n*** MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH COMPLETE ***')
Execution Output

Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 5)

Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import json import time import os from datetime import datetime print('=== MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH: WIL G. PANSTERS & ARIJ OUWENEEL (RESTRUCTURED) ===') print('Objective: Find articles about Mexican rural history by the editors of the 1992 UCSD publication') print('Target Authors: Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel') print('Focus: Academic articles, journal publications, book chapters on rural Mexican historical topics') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both authors and Mexican rural history search_queries = [ # Wil G. Pansters focused searches 'Wil G. Pansters Mexican rural history article', '"Wil G. Pansters" rural Mexico history publication', 'Pansters rural Mexico peasants agriculture history', 'Wil Pansters Mexico countryside rural development history', '"Wil G. Pansters" Mexican agrarian history journal article', # Arij Ouweneel focused searches 'Arij Ouweneel Mexican rural history publication', '"Arij Ouweneel" rural Mexico history article', 'Ouweneel rural history Mexico peasants agriculture', 'Arij Ouweneel Mexico countryside rural development', '"Arij Ouweneel" Mexican agrarian history journal', # Combined and broader searches 'Pansters Ouweneel Mexican rural history editors', '"Region State Capitalism Mexico" editors rural history articles', 'Wil Pansters Arij Ouweneel rural Mexico publications', 'Mexican rural history Pansters Ouweneel academic articles', 'Center U.S.-Mexican Studies editors rural history publications' ] print(f'Total search queries planned: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch Strategy:') print('1. Target both authors individually with rural history keywords') print('2. Use exact name matching with quotes for precision') print('3. Include related terms: peasants, agriculture, agrarian, countryside') print('4. Cross-reference with their editorial work') print('5. Focus on academic publications and journal articles') print('\n' + '=' * 80) # Store all search results with detailed analysis all_results = [] results_by_author = { 'wil_pansters': [], 'arij_ouweneel': [], 'both_authors': [], 'related_publications': [] } # Define analysis functions to avoid scoping issues def analyze_result_content(title, body): """Analyze a single search result for author mentions and topic relevance""" # Create combined text for analysis combined_text = f'{str(title).lower()} {str(body).lower()}' # Check for author names has_pansters = any(term in combined_text for term in ['pansters', 'wil g. pansters', 'wil pansters']) has_ouweneel = any(term in combined_text for term in ['ouweneel', 'arij ouweneel']) # Check for rural history indicators rural_indicators = [ 'rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'peasants', 'agrarian', 'agriculture', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'ejido', 'campesino', 'campesinos', 'land reform', 'rural development', 'rural society', 'rural economy', 'agricultural history' ] found_rural_terms = [term for term in rural_indicators if term in combined_text] # Check for Mexican/Mexico context has_mexico_context = any(term in combined_text for term in ['mexico', 'mexican', 'm√©xico']) # Check for academic publication indicators academic_indicators = [ 'journal', 'article', 'publication', 'paper', 'chapter', 'book', 'study', 'research', 'academic', 'university', 'press', 'published', 'author' ] found_academic_terms = [term for term in academic_indicators if term in combined_text] # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 if has_pansters: relevance_score += 3 if has_ouweneel: relevance_score += 3 if found_rural_terms: relevance_score += len(found_rural_terms) if has_mexico_context: relevance_score += 2 if found_academic_terms: relevance_score += len(found_academic_terms) return { 'has_pansters': has_pansters, 'has_ouweneel': has_ouweneel, 'has_mexico_context': has_mexico_context, 'found_rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'found_academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score } # Execute comprehensive searches for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\n[SEARCH {i}/{len(search_queries)}] {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Perform search with multiple backends for comprehensive coverage results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): # Extract result data with safe defaults title = result.get('title', 'No title') body = result.get('body', 'No description') href = result.get('href', 'No URL') print(f'\nResult {j}:') print(f'Title: {title}') print(f'Description: {body}') print(f'URL: {href}') # Analyze content using the separate function analysis = analyze_result_content(title, body) # Categorize results based on analysis categories = [] if analysis['has_pansters'] and not analysis['has_ouweneel']: categories.append('Wil Pansters') results_by_author['wil_pansters'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'] }) elif analysis['has_ouweneel'] and not analysis['has_pansters']: categories.append('Arij Ouweneel') results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'] }) elif analysis['has_pansters'] and analysis['has_ouweneel']: categories.append('Both Authors') results_by_author['both_authors'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'] }) elif analysis['found_rural_terms'] and analysis['has_mexico_context'] and analysis['found_academic_terms']: categories.append('Related Publication') results_by_author['related_publications'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'] }) # Display analysis results if categories: print(f'üéØ RELEVANT: {", ".join(categories)} (Score: {analysis["relevance_score"]})') if analysis['found_rural_terms']: print(f' Rural terms: {analysis["found_rural_terms"]}') if analysis['found_academic_terms']: print(f' Academic terms: {analysis["found_academic_terms"][:5]}') # Show first 5 if analysis['has_mexico_context']: print(f' ‚úì Mexican context confirmed') else: print(f' Low relevance (Score: {analysis["relevance_score"]})') print('-' * 40) # Store comprehensive result data all_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'has_pansters': analysis['has_pansters'], 'has_ouweneel': analysis['has_ouweneel'], 'has_mexico_context': analysis['has_mexico_context'], 'rural_terms_found': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms_found': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'], 'categories': categories }) else: print('No results found for this query') except Exception as e: print(f'Error during search {i}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() # Brief pause between searches to avoid rate limiting time.sleep(1) print('=' * 80) # Generate comprehensive analysis print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH ANALYSIS ===') total_results = len(all_results) print(f'Total search queries executed: {len(search_queries)}') print(f'Total results collected: {total_results}') # Analyze results by author print('\n--- RESULTS BY AUTHOR ---') print(f'Wil G. Pansters results: {len(results_by_author["wil_pansters"])}') print(f'Arij Ouweneel results: {len(results_by_author["arij_ouweneel"])}') print(f'Both authors mentioned: {len(results_by_author["both_authors"])}') print(f'Related publications: {len(results_by_author["related_publications"])}') # Identify top findings for each author print('\n=== TOP FINDINGS BY AUTHOR ===') # Wil G. Pansters top findings if results_by_author['wil_pansters']: print('\nüìö WIL G. PANSTERS - TOP RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATIONS:') pansters_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['wil_pansters'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(pansters_sorted[:5], 1): # Top 5 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Source query: {result["query"]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific results found for Wil G. Pansters rural history articles') # Arij Ouweneel top findings if results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']: print('\nüìö ARIJ OUWENEEL - TOP RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATIONS:') ouweneel_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(ouweneel_sorted[:5], 1): # Top 5 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Source query: {result["query"]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific results found for Arij Ouweneel rural history articles') # Combined findings if results_by_author['both_authors']: print('\nüìö COLLABORATIVE OR COMPARATIVE WORKS:') both_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['both_authors'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(both_sorted[:3], 1): # Top 3 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') # Save comprehensive research data research_data = { 'research_objective': 'Find Mexican rural history articles by Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel', 'target_authors': { 'primary': 'Wil G. Pansters', 'secondary': 'Arij Ouweneel', 'context': 'Editors of 1992 Center for U.S.-Mexican Studies publication "Region, State and Capitalism in Mexico"' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': total_results, 'queries_executed': search_queries }, 'results_by_category': results_by_author, 'all_results': all_results, 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } # Save detailed results detailed_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json' with open(detailed_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) # Save summary report summary_report = { 'research_title': 'Mexican Rural History Articles by Pansters and Ouweneel', 'research_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d'), 'authors_researched': ['Wil G. Pansters', 'Arij Ouweneel'], 'search_results_summary': { 'wil_pansters_articles': len(results_by_author['wil_pansters']), 'arij_ouweneel_articles': len(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']), 'collaborative_works': len(results_by_author['both_authors']), 'related_publications': len(results_by_author['related_publications']) }, 'top_findings': { 'pansters_top_3': sorted(results_by_author['wil_pansters'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True)[:3], 'ouweneel_top_3': sorted(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True)[:3] }, 'research_notes': [ 'Searched for academic articles specifically on Mexican rural history topics', 'Focused on journal publications, book chapters, and academic papers', 'Used comprehensive keyword combinations including rural, agrarian, peasant terms', 'Cross-referenced with their known editorial work on Mexican regional studies' ] } summary_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_research_summary.json' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(summary_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n=== RESEARCH DATA SAVED ===') print(f'Detailed results: {detailed_file}') print(f'Summary report: {summary_file}') # Final summary print(f'\n=== FINAL RESEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(f'‚úì Executed {len(search_queries)} comprehensive searches') print(f'‚úì Collected {total_results} total results') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(results_by_author["wil_pansters"])} Wil G. Pansters publications') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(results_by_author["arij_ouweneel"])} Arij Ouweneel publications') print(f'‚úì Found {len(results_by_author["both_authors"])} collaborative/comparative works') print(f'‚úì Located {len(results_by_author["related_publications"])} related rural history publications') if results_by_author['wil_pansters'] or results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']: print('\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found specific rural history publications by target authors') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Few specific publications found - may need targeted database searches') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review detailed results for specific publication dates and venues') print('2. Cross-reference findings with academic databases (JSTOR, Project MUSE)') print('3. Examine university repository and author CV pages') print('4. Verify publication details and citation information') print('5. Compile final bibliography of rural history articles by both authors') print('\n*** MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH COMPLETE ***')
Execution Output
Code Output: === MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH: WIL G. PANSTERS & ARIJ OUWENEEL (RESTRUCTURED) === Objective: Find articles about Mexican rural history by the editors of the 1992 UCSD publication Target Authors: Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel Focus: Academic articles, journal publications, book chapters on rural Mexican historical topics ================================================================================ Total search queries planned: 15 Search Strategy: 1. Target both authors individually with rural history keywords 2. Use exact name matching with quotes for precision 3. Include related terms: peasants, agriculture, agrarian, countryside 4. Cross-reference with their editorial work 5. Focus on academic publications and journal articles ================================================================================ [SEARCH 1/15] Wil G. Pansters Mexican rural history article ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Found 8 results Result 1: Title: Regional Mexican history: Treasury or Pandora's Box? Description: Little more than two years ago the History Department of the Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico organized a large-scale seminar on the state of affairs of Mexico 's regional historiography . The meetings took place in the town of Taxco, a drive of one and a half hours south of Mexico City. Escobar Ohmstede, Antonio y J... URL: https://www.academia.edu/36786074/Mexico_in_Transition_New_Perspectives_on_Mexican_Agrarian_History_Nineteenth_and_Twentieth_Centuries 3. 2025-08-10 13:29:09
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the **PLAN** requirements. The script successfully executed all 15 comprehensive search queries targeting Mexican rural history articles by Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel, the editors of the 1992 Center for U.S.-Mexican Studies publication. The code collected 120 total results and properly analyzed them using relevance scoring based on author mentions, rural history indicators, Mexican context, and academic publication terms. Results were categorized into: 33 Wil G. Pansters publications, 27 Arij Ouweneel publications, 12 collaborative works, and 8 related publications. Top findings include specific rural history publications like Ouweneel's work on agrarian cycles, Pansters' research on Mexican regional studies, and their collaborative 'Region, State and Capitalism in Mexico' editorial work. The analysis successfully identified academic articles, journal publications, and book chapters on rural Mexican historical topics by both authors. **PLAN** alignment: 100% - comprehensive research data was saved to detailed JSON files in workspace/ with top findings ranked by relevance scores. The research objective has been achieved and no further development is needed.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import json import time import os from datetime import datetime print('=== MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH: WIL G. PANSTERS & ARIJ OUWENEEL (RESTRUCTURED) ===') print('Objective: Find articles about Mexican rural history by the editors of the 1992 UCSD publication') print('Target Authors: Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel') print('Focus: Academic articles, journal publications, book chapters on rural Mexican historical topics') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both authors and Mexican rural history search_queries = [ # Wil G. Pansters focused searches 'Wil G. Pansters Mexican rural history article', '"Wil G. Pansters" rural Mexico history publication', 'Pansters rural Mexico peasants agriculture history', 'Wil Pansters Mexico countryside rural development history', '"Wil G. Pansters" Mexican agrarian history journal article', # Arij Ouweneel focused searches 'Arij Ouweneel Mexican rural history publication', '"Arij Ouweneel" rural Mexico history article', 'Ouweneel rural history Mexico peasants agriculture', 'Arij Ouweneel Mexico countryside rural development', '"Arij Ouweneel" Mexican agrarian history journal', # Combined and broader searches 'Pansters Ouweneel Mexican rural history editors', '"Region State Capitalism Mexico" editors rural history articles', 'Wil Pansters Arij Ouweneel rural Mexico publications', 'Mexican rural history Pansters Ouweneel academic articles', 'Center U.S.-Mexican Studies editors rural history publications' ] print(f'Total search queries planned: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch Strategy:') print('1. Target both authors individually with rural history keywords') print('2. Use exact name matching with quotes for precision') print('3. Include related terms: peasants, agriculture, agrarian, countryside') print('4. Cross-reference with their editorial work') print('5. Focus on academic publications and journal articles') print('\n' + '=' * 80) # Store all search results with detailed analysis all_results = [] results_by_author = { 'wil_pansters': [], 'arij_ouweneel': [], 'both_authors': [], 'related_publications': [] } # Define analysis functions to avoid scoping issues def analyze_result_content(title, body): """Analyze a single search result for author mentions and topic relevance""" # Create combined text for analysis combined_text = f'{str(title).lower()} {str(body).lower()}' # Check for author names has_pansters = any(term in combined_text for term in ['pansters', 'wil g. pansters', 'wil pansters']) has_ouweneel = any(term in combined_text for term in ['ouweneel', 'arij ouweneel']) # Check for rural history indicators rural_indicators = [ 'rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'peasants', 'agrarian', 'agriculture', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'ejido', 'campesino', 'campesinos', 'land reform', 'rural development', 'rural society', 'rural economy', 'agricultural history' ] found_rural_terms = [term for term in rural_indicators if term in combined_text] # Check for Mexican/Mexico context has_mexico_context = any(term in combined_text for term in ['mexico', 'mexican', 'm√©xico']) # Check for academic publication indicators academic_indicators = [ 'journal', 'article', 'publication', 'paper', 'chapter', 'book', 'study', 'research', 'academic', 'university', 'press', 'published', 'author' ] found_academic_terms = [term for term in academic_indicators if term in combined_text] # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 if has_pansters: relevance_score += 3 if has_ouweneel: relevance_score += 3 if found_rural_terms: relevance_score += len(found_rural_terms) if has_mexico_context: relevance_score += 2 if found_academic_terms: relevance_score += len(found_academic_terms) return { 'has_pansters': has_pansters, 'has_ouweneel': has_ouweneel, 'has_mexico_context': has_mexico_context, 'found_rural_terms': found_rural_terms, 'found_academic_terms': found_academic_terms, 'relevance_score': relevance_score } # Execute comprehensive searches for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\n[SEARCH {i}/{len(search_queries)}] {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Perform search with multiple backends for comprehensive coverage results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): # Extract result data with safe defaults title = result.get('title', 'No title') body = result.get('body', 'No description') href = result.get('href', 'No URL') print(f'\nResult {j}:') print(f'Title: {title}') print(f'Description: {body}') print(f'URL: {href}') # Analyze content using the separate function analysis = analyze_result_content(title, body) # Categorize results based on analysis categories = [] if analysis['has_pansters'] and not analysis['has_ouweneel']: categories.append('Wil Pansters') results_by_author['wil_pansters'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'] }) elif analysis['has_ouweneel'] and not analysis['has_pansters']: categories.append('Arij Ouweneel') results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'] }) elif analysis['has_pansters'] and analysis['has_ouweneel']: categories.append('Both Authors') results_by_author['both_authors'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'] }) elif analysis['found_rural_terms'] and analysis['has_mexico_context'] and analysis['found_academic_terms']: categories.append('Related Publication') results_by_author['related_publications'].append({ 'query': query, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'rural_terms': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'] }) # Display analysis results if categories: print(f'üéØ RELEVANT: {", ".join(categories)} (Score: {analysis["relevance_score"]})') if analysis['found_rural_terms']: print(f' Rural terms: {analysis["found_rural_terms"]}') if analysis['found_academic_terms']: print(f' Academic terms: {analysis["found_academic_terms"][:5]}') # Show first 5 if analysis['has_mexico_context']: print(f' ‚úì Mexican context confirmed') else: print(f' Low relevance (Score: {analysis["relevance_score"]})') print('-' * 40) # Store comprehensive result data all_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'has_pansters': analysis['has_pansters'], 'has_ouweneel': analysis['has_ouweneel'], 'has_mexico_context': analysis['has_mexico_context'], 'rural_terms_found': analysis['found_rural_terms'], 'academic_terms_found': analysis['found_academic_terms'], 'relevance_score': analysis['relevance_score'], 'categories': categories }) else: print('No results found for this query') except Exception as e: print(f'Error during search {i}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() # Brief pause between searches to avoid rate limiting time.sleep(1) print('=' * 80) # Generate comprehensive analysis print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH ANALYSIS ===') total_results = len(all_results) print(f'Total search queries executed: {len(search_queries)}') print(f'Total results collected: {total_results}') # Analyze results by author print('\n--- RESULTS BY AUTHOR ---') print(f'Wil G. Pansters results: {len(results_by_author["wil_pansters"])}') print(f'Arij Ouweneel results: {len(results_by_author["arij_ouweneel"])}') print(f'Both authors mentioned: {len(results_by_author["both_authors"])}') print(f'Related publications: {len(results_by_author["related_publications"])}') # Identify top findings for each author print('\n=== TOP FINDINGS BY AUTHOR ===') # Wil G. Pansters top findings if results_by_author['wil_pansters']: print('\nüìö WIL G. PANSTERS - TOP RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATIONS:') pansters_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['wil_pansters'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(pansters_sorted[:5], 1): # Top 5 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Source query: {result["query"]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific results found for Wil G. Pansters rural history articles') # Arij Ouweneel top findings if results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']: print('\nüìö ARIJ OUWENEEL - TOP RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATIONS:') ouweneel_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(ouweneel_sorted[:5], 1): # Top 5 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Source query: {result["query"]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è No specific results found for Arij Ouweneel rural history articles') # Combined findings if results_by_author['both_authors']: print('\nüìö COLLABORATIVE OR COMPARATIVE WORKS:') both_sorted = sorted(results_by_author['both_authors'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) for i, result in enumerate(both_sorted[:3], 1): # Top 3 print(f'\n{i}. {result["title"]}') print(f' Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Rural terms: {result["rural_terms"]}') print(f' Description: {result["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') # Save comprehensive research data research_data = { 'research_objective': 'Find Mexican rural history articles by Wil G. Pansters and Arij Ouweneel', 'target_authors': { 'primary': 'Wil G. Pansters', 'secondary': 'Arij Ouweneel', 'context': 'Editors of 1992 Center for U.S.-Mexican Studies publication "Region, State and Capitalism in Mexico"' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': total_results, 'queries_executed': search_queries }, 'results_by_category': results_by_author, 'all_results': all_results, 'research_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() } # Save detailed results detailed_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json' with open(detailed_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) # Save summary report summary_report = { 'research_title': 'Mexican Rural History Articles by Pansters and Ouweneel', 'research_date': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d'), 'authors_researched': ['Wil G. Pansters', 'Arij Ouweneel'], 'search_results_summary': { 'wil_pansters_articles': len(results_by_author['wil_pansters']), 'arij_ouweneel_articles': len(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']), 'collaborative_works': len(results_by_author['both_authors']), 'related_publications': len(results_by_author['related_publications']) }, 'top_findings': { 'pansters_top_3': sorted(results_by_author['wil_pansters'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True)[:3], 'ouweneel_top_3': sorted(results_by_author['arij_ouweneel'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True)[:3] }, 'research_notes': [ 'Searched for academic articles specifically on Mexican rural history topics', 'Focused on journal publications, book chapters, and academic papers', 'Used comprehensive keyword combinations including rural, agrarian, peasant terms', 'Cross-referenced with their known editorial work on Mexican regional studies' ] } summary_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_research_summary.json' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(summary_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n=== RESEARCH DATA SAVED ===') print(f'Detailed results: {detailed_file}') print(f'Summary report: {summary_file}') # Final summary print(f'\n=== FINAL RESEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(f'‚úì Executed {len(search_queries)} comprehensive searches') print(f'‚úì Collected {total_results} total results') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(results_by_author["wil_pansters"])} Wil G. Pansters publications') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(results_by_author["arij_ouweneel"])} Arij Ouweneel publications') print(f'‚úì Found {len(results_by_author["both_authors"])} collaborative/comparative works') print(f'‚úì Located {len(results_by_author["related_publications"])} related rural history publications') if results_by_author['wil_pansters'] or results_by_author['arij_ouweneel']: print('\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found specific rural history publications by target authors') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Few specific publications found - may need targeted database searches') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review detailed results for specific publication dates and venues') print('2. Cross-reference findings with academic databases (JSTOR, Project MUSE)') print('3. Examine university repository and author CV pages') print('4. Verify publication details and citation information') print('5. Compile final bibliography of rural history articles by both authors') print('\n*** MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY RESEARCH COMPLETE ***')
Execution Output

The meetings took place in the town of Taxco, a drive of one and a half hours south of Mexico City.
