2025-08-10 13:36:01
Code Execution - Plan #4 (Iteration 7)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json print('=== EXTRACTING MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATION YEARS ===') print('Objective: Find specific publication years for Mexican rural history articles by Pansters and Ouweneel') print('Focus: Articles specifically about rural Mexican historical topics\n') # First, let's inspect the main research file structure to understand the data format detailed_file = 'mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json' file_path = os.path.join('workspace', detailed_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f'=== STEP 1: INSPECTING FILE STRUCTURE ===') print(f'Analyzing: {detailed_file}') file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f'File size: {file_size:,} bytes') try: # Load and inspect the JSON structure first with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'\nJSON root type: {type(data).__name__}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Root dictionary keys: {list(data.keys())}') # Inspect the 'all_results' section which seems most promising if 'all_results' in data: all_results = data['all_results'] print(f'\nall_results section: {type(all_results).__name__} with {len(all_results)} items') if all_results and isinstance(all_results[0], dict): sample_result = all_results[0] print(f'Sample result keys: {list(sample_result.keys())}') # Show sample values for key fields key_fields = ['title', 'has_pansters', 'has_ouweneel', 'has_mexico_context', 'rural_terms_found'] print('\nSample result content:') for field in key_fields: if field in sample_result: value = sample_result[field] if isinstance(value, str) and len(value) > 100: print(f' {field}: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' {field}: {value}') print('\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR RURAL MEXICAN HISTORY ARTICLES ===') # Now search through the results for rural Mexican history articles rural_mexican_articles = [] if 'all_results' in data: print(f'Analyzing {len(data["all_results"])} research results...') for i, result in enumerate(data['all_results']): if not isinstance(result, dict): continue # Check if this result has the required criteria has_pansters = result.get('has_pansters', False) has_ouweneel = result.get('has_ouweneel', False) has_mexico_context = result.get('has_mexico_context', False) rural_terms = result.get('rural_terms_found', []) # Check if this is about rural topics - FIXED: proper variable scoping result_text = str(result).lower() rural_keywords = ['rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'agrarian'] has_rural_content = bool(rural_terms) or any(term in result_text for term in rural_keywords) # Must have at least one author and Mexican context and rural content if (has_pansters or has_ouweneel) and has_mexico_context and has_rural_content: print(f'\nüìÑ CANDIDATE {i+1}: Rural Mexican history article found') print(f' Authors: Pansters={has_pansters}, Ouweneel={has_ouweneel}') print(f' Mexican context: {has_mexico_context}') print(f' Rural terms: {rural_terms}') # Extract title and other details title = result.get('title', 'No title') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('url', '') print(f' Title: {title[:150]}...' if len(title) > 150 else f' Title: {title}') # Look for publication years in the content content_text = f'{title} {body}'.lower() years_found = [] # Search for years in 1990s-2000s range for year in range(1990, 2010): if str(year) in content_text: years_found.append(year) print(f' Years found in content: {years_found}') # Determine primary author if has_pansters and has_ouweneel: primary_author = 'Both Pansters and Ouweneel' elif has_pansters: primary_author = 'Wil G. Pansters' elif has_ouweneel: primary_author = 'Arij Ouweneel' else: primary_author = 'Unknown' # Store article information article_info = { 'result_index': i, 'primary_author': primary_author, 'has_pansters': has_pansters, 'has_ouweneel': has_ouweneel, 'title': title, 'publication_years': years_found, 'rural_terms_found': rural_terms, 'url': url, 'body_preview': body[:300] if len(body) > 300 else body, 'full_body': body } rural_mexican_articles.append(article_info) print(f' ‚úÖ Added to results: {primary_author} - Years: {years_found}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING EXTRACTED ARTICLES ===') print(f'Total rural Mexican history articles found: {len(rural_mexican_articles)}') if rural_mexican_articles: print('\n=== DETAILED RESULTS BY AUTHOR ===') # Group by author pansters_articles = [a for a in rural_mexican_articles if a['has_pansters']] ouweneel_articles = [a for a in rural_mexican_articles if a['has_ouweneel']] print(f'\nArticles by Wil G. Pansters: {len(pansters_articles)}') pansters_years = set() for i, article in enumerate(pansters_articles, 1): print(f' {i}. Title: {article["title"][:100]}...' if len(article['title']) > 100 else f' {i}. Title: {article["title"]}') print(f' Years: {article["publication_years"]}') print(f' Rural terms: {article["rural_terms_found"]}') pansters_years.update(article['publication_years']) print() print(f'Articles by Arij Ouweneel: {len(ouweneel_articles)}') ouweneel_years = set() for i, article in enumerate(ouweneel_articles, 1): print(f' {i}. Title: {article["title"][:100]}...' if len(article['title']) > 100 else f' {i}. Title: {article["title"]}') print(f' Years: {article["publication_years"]}') print(f' Rural terms: {article["rural_terms_found"]}') ouweneel_years.update(article['publication_years']) print() # Extract all unique years all_years = set() for article in rural_mexican_articles: all_years.update(article['publication_years']) print(f'=== FINAL PUBLICATION YEAR EXTRACTION ===') print(f'All publication years found: {sorted(list(all_years))}') print(f'Pansters publication years: {sorted(list(pansters_years))}') print(f'Ouweneel publication years: {sorted(list(ouweneel_years))}') # Save detailed results extraction_results = { 'extraction_objective': 'Extract publication years of Mexican rural history articles by Pansters and Ouweneel', 'search_criteria': 'Articles specifically about rural Mexican historical topics', 'total_articles_found': len(rural_mexican_articles), 'articles_by_pansters': len(pansters_articles), 'articles_by_ouweneel': len(ouweneel_articles), 'all_publication_years': sorted(list(all_years)), 'pansters_publication_years': sorted(list(pansters_years)), 'ouweneel_publication_years': sorted(list(ouweneel_years)), 'detailed_articles': rural_mexican_articles, 'source_file': detailed_file, 'extraction_timestamp': '2025-01-21' } results_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_final_extraction.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úÖ RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final summary print(f'\nüéØ EXTRACTION SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total rural Mexican history articles: {len(rural_mexican_articles)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Articles by Pansters: {len(pansters_articles)} (Years: {sorted(list(pansters_years))})') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Articles by Ouweneel: {len(ouweneel_articles)} (Years: {sorted(list(ouweneel_years))})') print(f' ‚Ä¢ All publication years: {sorted(list(all_years))}') else: print('\n‚ö† No rural Mexican history articles found matching the criteria') print('Let me examine the results_by_category section for additional insights...') # Check the results_by_category section if 'results_by_category' in data: categories = data['results_by_category'] print(f'\nAvailable categories: {list(categories.keys())}') for category, results in categories.items(): if isinstance(results, list) and results: print(f'\n{category}: {len(results)} items') # Show first item as example if isinstance(results[0], dict): sample = results[0] print(f' Sample keys: {list(sample.keys())}') if 'title' in sample: print(f' Sample title: {sample["title"][:100]}...') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON parsing error: {str(e)}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error analyzing file: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() else: print(f'‚ùå {detailed_file} not found in workspace') # List available files if os.path.exists('workspace'): print('\nAvailable files in workspace:') for file in sorted(os.listdir('workspace')): if file.endswith('.json'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

tester
2025-08-10 13:36:02
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError due to variable scope issue with 'result' in generator expression on line 67. The code successfully completed comprehensive analysis: (1) Inspected file structure of mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json (147KB), (2) Confirmed JSON structure with 120 research results containing key fields like 'has_pansters', 'has_ouweneel', 'has_mexico_context', 'rural_terms_found', (3) Found sample result showing proper data structure for extraction. However, execution stopped when filtering results because 'result' variable in the generator expression is not properly scoped within the loop context. **PLAN** alignment: 75% - file inspection completed, JSON structure analyzed, search criteria identified, but article extraction halted due to variable reference error. Quick fix: The error occurs in the line 'any(term in str(result).lower() for term in [...])' where 'result' should be properly referenced within the loop scope. The data structure is perfect for extracting Mexican rural history publication years from both authors once the scoping issue is resolved.
Python Code python
import os import json print('=== EXTRACTING MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATION YEARS ===') print('Objective: Find specific publication years for Mexican rural history articles by Pansters and Ouweneel') print('Focus: Articles specifically about rural Mexican historical topics\n') # First, let's inspect the main research file structure to understand the data format detailed_file = 'mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json' file_path = os.path.join('workspace', detailed_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f'=== STEP 1: INSPECTING FILE STRUCTURE ===') print(f'Analyzing: {detailed_file}') file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f'File size: {file_size:,} bytes') try: # Load and inspect the JSON structure first with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'\nJSON root type: {type(data).__name__}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Root dictionary keys: {list(data.keys())}') # Inspect the 'all_results' section which seems most promising if 'all_results' in data: all_results = data['all_results'] print(f'\nall_results section: {type(all_results).__name__} with {len(all_results)} items') if all_results and isinstance(all_results[0], dict): sample_result = all_results[0] print(f'Sample result keys: {list(sample_result.keys())}') # Show sample values for key fields key_fields = ['title', 'has_pansters', 'has_ouweneel', 'has_mexico_context', 'rural_terms_found'] print('\nSample result content:') for field in key_fields: if field in sample_result: value = sample_result[field] if isinstance(value, str) and len(value) > 100: print(f' {field}: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' {field}: {value}') print('\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR RURAL MEXICAN HISTORY ARTICLES ===') # Now search through the results for rural Mexican history articles rural_mexican_articles = [] if 'all_results' in data: print(f'Analyzing {len(data["all_results"])} research results...') for i, result in enumerate(data['all_results']): if not isinstance(result, dict): continue # Check if this result has the required criteria has_pansters = result.get('has_pansters', False) has_ouweneel = result.get('has_ouweneel', False) has_mexico_context = result.get('has_mexico_context', False) rural_terms = result.get('rural_terms_found', []) # Check if this is about rural topics - FIXED: proper variable scoping result_text = str(result).lower() rural_keywords = ['rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'agrarian'] has_rural_content = bool(rural_terms) or any(term in result_text for term in rural_keywords) # Must have at least one author and Mexican context and rural content if (has_pansters or has_ouweneel) and has_mexico_context and has_rural_content: print(f'\nüìÑ CANDIDATE {i+1}: Rural Mexican history article found') print(f' Authors: Pansters={has_pansters}, Ouweneel={has_ouweneel}') print(f' Mexican context: {has_mexico_context}') print(f' Rural terms: {rural_terms}') # Extract title and other details title = result.get('title', 'No title') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('url', '') print(f' Title: {title[:150]}...' if len(title) > 150 else f' Title: {title}') # Look for publication years in the content content_text = f'{title} {body}'.lower() years_found = [] # Search for years in 1990s-2000s range for year in range(1990, 2010): if str(year) in content_text: years_found.append(year) print(f' Years found in content: {years_found}') # Determine primary author if has_pansters and has_ouweneel: primary_author = 'Both Pansters and Ouweneel' elif has_pansters: primary_author = 'Wil G. Pansters' elif has_ouweneel: primary_author = 'Arij Ouweneel' else: primary_author = 'Unknown' # Store article information article_info = { 'result_index': i, 'primary_author': primary_author, 'has_pansters': has_pansters, 'has_ouweneel': has_ouweneel, 'title': title, 'publication_years': years_found, 'rural_terms_found': rural_terms, 'url': url, 'body_preview': body[:300] if len(body) > 300 else body, 'full_body': body } rural_mexican_articles.append(article_info) print(f' ‚úÖ Added to results: {primary_author} - Years: {years_found}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING EXTRACTED ARTICLES ===') print(f'Total rural Mexican history articles found: {len(rural_mexican_articles)}') if rural_mexican_articles: print('\n=== DETAILED RESULTS BY AUTHOR ===') # Group by author pansters_articles = [a for a in rural_mexican_articles if a['has_pansters']] ouweneel_articles = [a for a in rural_mexican_articles if a['has_ouweneel']] print(f'\nArticles by Wil G. Pansters: {len(pansters_articles)}') pansters_years = set() for i, article in enumerate(pansters_articles, 1): print(f' {i}. Title: {article["title"][:100]}...' if len(article['title']) > 100 else f' {i}. Title: {article["title"]}') print(f' Years: {article["publication_years"]}') print(f' Rural terms: {article["rural_terms_found"]}') pansters_years.update(article['publication_years']) print() print(f'Articles by Arij Ouweneel: {len(ouweneel_articles)}') ouweneel_years = set() for i, article in enumerate(ouweneel_articles, 1): print(f' {i}. Title: {article["title"][:100]}...' if len(article['title']) > 100 else f' {i}. Title: {article["title"]}') print(f' Years: {article["publication_years"]}') print(f' Rural terms: {article["rural_terms_found"]}') ouweneel_years.update(article['publication_years']) print() # Extract all unique years all_years = set() for article in rural_mexican_articles: all_years.update(article['publication_years']) print(f'=== FINAL PUBLICATION YEAR EXTRACTION ===') print(f'All publication years found: {sorted(list(all_years))}') print(f'Pansters publication years: {sorted(list(pansters_years))}') print(f'Ouweneel publication years: {sorted(list(ouweneel_years))}') # Save detailed results extraction_results = { 'extraction_objective': 'Extract publication years of Mexican rural history articles by Pansters and Ouweneel', 'search_criteria': 'Articles specifically about rural Mexican historical topics', 'total_articles_found': len(rural_mexican_articles), 'articles_by_pansters': len(pansters_articles), 'articles_by_ouweneel': len(ouweneel_articles), 'all_publication_years': sorted(list(all_years)), 'pansters_publication_years': sorted(list(pansters_years)), 'ouweneel_publication_years': sorted(list(ouweneel_years)), 'detailed_articles': rural_mexican_articles, 'source_file': detailed_file, 'extraction_timestamp': '2025-01-21' } results_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_final_extraction.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úÖ RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final summary print(f'\nüéØ EXTRACTION SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total rural Mexican history articles: {len(rural_mexican_articles)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Articles by Pansters: {len(pansters_articles)} (Years: {sorted(list(pansters_years))})') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Articles by Ouweneel: {len(ouweneel_articles)} (Years: {sorted(list(ouweneel_years))})') print(f' ‚Ä¢ All publication years: {sorted(list(all_years))}') else: print('\n‚ö† No rural Mexican history articles found matching the criteria') print('Let me examine the results_by_category section for additional insights...') # Check the results_by_category section if 'results_by_category' in data: categories = data['results_by_category'] print(f'\nAvailable categories: {list(categories.keys())}') for category, results in categories.items(): if isinstance(results, list) and results: print(f'\n{category}: {len(results)} items') # Show first item as example if isinstance(results[0], dict): sample = results[0] print(f' Sample keys: {list(sample.keys())}') if 'title' in sample: print(f' Sample title: {sample["title"][:100]}...') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON parsing error: {str(e)}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error analyzing file: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() else: print(f'‚ùå {detailed_file} not found in workspace') # List available files if os.path.exists('workspace'): print('\nAvailable files in workspace:') for file in sorted(os.listdir('workspace')): if file.endswith('.json'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')

Code Execution - Plan #4 (Iteration 8)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json print('=== EXTRACTING MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATION YEARS ===') print('Objective: Find specific publication years for Mexican rural history articles by Pansters and Ouweneel') print('Focus: Articles specifically about rural Mexican historical topics\n') # First, let's inspect the main research file structure to understand the data format detailed_file = 'mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json' file_path = os.path.join('workspace', detailed_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f'=== STEP 1: INSPECTING FILE STRUCTURE ===') print(f'Analyzing: {detailed_file}') file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f'File size: {file_size:,} bytes') try: # Load and inspect the JSON structure first with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'\nJSON root type: {type(data).__name__}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Root dictionary keys: {list(data.keys())}') # Inspect the 'all_results' section which seems most promising if 'all_results' in data: all_results = data['all_results'] print(f'\nall_results section: {type(all_results).__name__} with {len(all_results)} items') if all_results and isinstance(all_results[0], dict): sample_result = all_results[0] print(f'Sample result keys: {list(sample_result.keys())}') # Show sample values for key fields key_fields = ['title', 'has_pansters', 'has_ouweneel', 'has_mexico_context', 'rural_terms_found'] print('\nSample result content:') for field in key_fields: if field in sample_result: value = sample_result[field] if isinstance(value, str) and len(value) > 100: print(f' {field}: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' {field}: {value}') print('\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR RURAL MEXICAN HISTORY ARTICLES ===') # Now search through the results for rural Mexican history articles rural_mexican_articles = [] if 'all_results' in data: print(f'Analyzing {len(data["all_results"])} research results...') for i, result in enumerate(data['all_results']): if not isinstance(result, dict): continue # Check if this result has the required criteria has_pansters = result.get('has_pansters', False) has_ouweneel = result.get('has_ouweneel', False) has_mexico_context = result.get('has_mexico_context', False) rural_terms = result.get('rural_terms_found', []) # Check if this is about rural topics - FIXED: define variables properly result_text = str(result).lower() rural_keywords = ['rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'agrarian'] # Check for rural content using properly scoped variables has_rural_keywords = False for keyword in rural_keywords: if keyword in result_text: has_rural_keywords = True break has_rural_content = bool(rural_terms) or has_rural_keywords # Must have at least one author and Mexican context and rural content if (has_pansters or has_ouweneel) and has_mexico_context and has_rural_content: print(f'\nüìÑ CANDIDATE {i+1}: Rural Mexican history article found') print(f' Authors: Pansters={has_pansters}, Ouweneel={has_ouweneel}') print(f' Mexican context: {has_mexico_context}') print(f' Rural terms: {rural_terms}') # Extract title and other details title = result.get('title', 'No title') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('url', '') print(f' Title: {title[:150]}...' if len(title) > 150 else f' Title: {title}') # Look for publication years in the content content_text = f'{title} {body}'.lower() years_found = [] # Search for years in 1990s-2000s range for year in range(1990, 2010): if str(year) in content_text: years_found.append(year) print(f' Years found in content: {years_found}') # Determine primary author if has_pansters and has_ouweneel: primary_author = 'Both Pansters and Ouweneel' elif has_pansters: primary_author = 'Wil G. Pansters' elif has_ouweneel: primary_author = 'Arij Ouweneel' else: primary_author = 'Unknown' # Store article information article_info = { 'result_index': i, 'primary_author': primary_author, 'has_pansters': has_pansters, 'has_ouweneel': has_ouweneel, 'title': title, 'publication_years': years_found, 'rural_terms_found': rural_terms, 'url': url, 'body_preview': body[:300] if len(body) > 300 else body, 'full_body': body } rural_mexican_articles.append(article_info) print(f' ‚úÖ Added to results: {primary_author} - Years: {years_found}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING EXTRACTED ARTICLES ===') print(f'Total rural Mexican history articles found: {len(rural_mexican_articles)}') if rural_mexican_articles: print('\n=== DETAILED RESULTS BY AUTHOR ===') # Group by author pansters_articles = [a for a in rural_mexican_articles if a['has_pansters']] ouweneel_articles = [a for a in rural_mexican_articles if a['has_ouweneel']] print(f'\nArticles by Wil G. Pansters: {len(pansters_articles)}') pansters_years = set() for i, article in enumerate(pansters_articles, 1): print(f' {i}. Title: {article["title"][:100]}...' if len(article['title']) > 100 else f' {i}. Title: {article["title"]}') print(f' Years: {article["publication_years"]}') print(f' Rural terms: {article["rural_terms_found"]}') pansters_years.update(article['publication_years']) print() print(f'Articles by Arij Ouweneel: {len(ouweneel_articles)}') ouweneel_years = set() for i, article in enumerate(ouweneel_articles, 1): print(f' {i}. Title: {article["title"][:100]}...' if len(article['title']) > 100 else f' {i}. Title: {article["title"]}') print(f' Years: {article["publication_years"]}') print(f' Rural terms: {article["rural_terms_found"]}') ouweneel_years.update(article['publication_years']) print() # Extract all unique years all_years = set() for article in rural_mexican_articles: all_years.update(article['publication_years']) print(f'=== FINAL PUBLICATION YEAR EXTRACTION ===') print(f'All publication years found: {sorted(list(all_years))}') print(f'Pansters publication years: {sorted(list(pansters_years))}') print(f'Ouweneel publication years: {sorted(list(ouweneel_years))}') # Save detailed results extraction_results = { 'extraction_objective': 'Extract publication years of Mexican rural history articles by Pansters and Ouweneel', 'search_criteria': 'Articles specifically about rural Mexican historical topics', 'total_articles_found': len(rural_mexican_articles), 'articles_by_pansters': len(pansters_articles), 'articles_by_ouweneel': len(ouweneel_articles), 'all_publication_years': sorted(list(all_years)), 'pansters_publication_years': sorted(list(pansters_years)), 'ouweneel_publication_years': sorted(list(ouweneel_years)), 'detailed_articles': rural_mexican_articles, 'source_file': detailed_file, 'extraction_timestamp': '2025-01-21' } results_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_final_extraction.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úÖ RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final summary print(f'\nüéØ EXTRACTION SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total rural Mexican history articles: {len(rural_mexican_articles)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Articles by Pansters: {len(pansters_articles)} (Years: {sorted(list(pansters_years))})') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Articles by Ouweneel: {len(ouweneel_articles)} (Years: {sorted(list(ouweneel_years))})') print(f' ‚Ä¢ All publication years: {sorted(list(all_years))}') else: print('\n‚ö† No rural Mexican history articles found matching the criteria') print('Let me examine the results_by_category section for additional insights...') # Check the results_by_category section if 'results_by_category' in data: categories = data['results_by_category'] print(f'\nAvailable categories: {list(categories.keys())}') for category, results in categories.items(): if isinstance(results, list) and results: print(f'\n{category}: {len(results)} items') # Show first item as example if isinstance(results[0], dict): sample = results[0] print(f' Sample keys: {list(sample.keys())}') if 'title' in sample: print(f' Sample title: {sample["title"][:100]}...') # Check if this category has rural Mexican content sample_text = str(sample).lower() has_rural_sample = any(term in sample_text for term in ['rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'agrarian']) has_mexican_sample = 'mexican' in sample_text or 'mexico' in sample_text if has_rural_sample and has_mexican_sample: print(f' ‚úÖ This category contains rural Mexican content!') # Look at more items from this promising category print(f' Examining first 3 items from {category}:') for j, item in enumerate(results[:3], 1): if isinstance(item, dict): item_title = item.get('title', 'No title') item_has_pansters = item.get('has_pansters', False) item_has_ouweneel = item.get('has_ouweneel', False) print(f' {j}. {item_title[:80]}...') print(f' Authors: Pansters={item_has_pansters}, Ouweneel={item_has_ouweneel}') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON parsing error: {str(e)}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error analyzing file: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() else: print(f'‚ùå {detailed_file} not found in workspace') # List available files if os.path.exists('workspace'): print('\nAvailable files in workspace:') for file in sorted(os.listdir('workspace')): if file.endswith('.json'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the **PLAN** requirements. The script successfully extracted publication years from 62 rural Mexican history articles by analyzing the comprehensive research data. Key results: (1) Found 43 articles by Wil G. Pansters with publication years [1990, 1991, 1993, 1995, 2000, 2001], (2) Found 31 articles by Arij Ouweneel with publication years [1990, 1991, 1992, 1993, 1995, 1996, 1998, 2001, 2003, 2009], (3) Identified specific rural Mexican history articles including 'What Was Behind Mexico's Peasant Revolution?' (1990), 'Haciendas and Agrarian Change in Rural Mesoamerica' (1996, 2003), and 'Mexico in Transition: New Perspectives on Mexican Agrarian' (2001). The analysis distinguished between general Mexican history and specifically rural topics as required. Results saved to 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_final_extraction.json' for verification. **PLAN** alignment: 100% - successfully extracted specific publication years for Mexican rural history articles by both authors. The comprehensive output contains valuable analysis data - recommend saving the detailed output to a local file for future reference given its length and research value.
Python Code python
import os import json print('=== EXTRACTING MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY PUBLICATION YEARS ===') print('Objective: Find specific publication years for Mexican rural history articles by Pansters and Ouweneel') print('Focus: Articles specifically about rural Mexican historical topics\n') # First, let's inspect the main research file structure to understand the data format detailed_file = 'mexican_rural_history_research_detailed.json' file_path = os.path.join('workspace', detailed_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f'=== STEP 1: INSPECTING FILE STRUCTURE ===') print(f'Analyzing: {detailed_file}') file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f'File size: {file_size:,} bytes') try: # Load and inspect the JSON structure first with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'\nJSON root type: {type(data).__name__}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Root dictionary keys: {list(data.keys())}') # Inspect the 'all_results' section which seems most promising if 'all_results' in data: all_results = data['all_results'] print(f'\nall_results section: {type(all_results).__name__} with {len(all_results)} items') if all_results and isinstance(all_results[0], dict): sample_result = all_results[0] print(f'Sample result keys: {list(sample_result.keys())}') # Show sample values for key fields key_fields = ['title', 'has_pansters', 'has_ouweneel', 'has_mexico_context', 'rural_terms_found'] print('\nSample result content:') for field in key_fields: if field in sample_result: value = sample_result[field] if isinstance(value, str) and len(value) > 100: print(f' {field}: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' {field}: {value}') print('\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR RURAL MEXICAN HISTORY ARTICLES ===') # Now search through the results for rural Mexican history articles rural_mexican_articles = [] if 'all_results' in data: print(f'Analyzing {len(data["all_results"])} research results...') for i, result in enumerate(data['all_results']): if not isinstance(result, dict): continue # Check if this result has the required criteria has_pansters = result.get('has_pansters', False) has_ouweneel = result.get('has_ouweneel', False) has_mexico_context = result.get('has_mexico_context', False) rural_terms = result.get('rural_terms_found', []) # Check if this is about rural topics - FIXED: define variables properly result_text = str(result).lower() rural_keywords = ['rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'agrarian'] # Check for rural content using properly scoped variables has_rural_keywords = False for keyword in rural_keywords: if keyword in result_text: has_rural_keywords = True break has_rural_content = bool(rural_terms) or has_rural_keywords # Must have at least one author and Mexican context and rural content if (has_pansters or has_ouweneel) and has_mexico_context and has_rural_content: print(f'\nüìÑ CANDIDATE {i+1}: Rural Mexican history article found') print(f' Authors: Pansters={has_pansters}, Ouweneel={has_ouweneel}') print(f' Mexican context: {has_mexico_context}') print(f' Rural terms: {rural_terms}') # Extract title and other details title = result.get('title', 'No title') body = result.get('body', '') url = result.get('url', '') print(f' Title: {title[:150]}...' if len(title) > 150 else f' Title: {title}') # Look for publication years in the content content_text = f'{title} {body}'.lower() years_found = [] # Search for years in 1990s-2000s range for year in range(1990, 2010): if str(year) in content_text: years_found.append(year) print(f' Years found in content: {years_found}') # Determine primary author if has_pansters and has_ouweneel: primary_author = 'Both Pansters and Ouweneel' elif has_pansters: primary_author = 'Wil G. Pansters' elif has_ouweneel: primary_author = 'Arij Ouweneel' else: primary_author = 'Unknown' # Store article information article_info = { 'result_index': i, 'primary_author': primary_author, 'has_pansters': has_pansters, 'has_ouweneel': has_ouweneel, 'title': title, 'publication_years': years_found, 'rural_terms_found': rural_terms, 'url': url, 'body_preview': body[:300] if len(body) > 300 else body, 'full_body': body } rural_mexican_articles.append(article_info) print(f' ‚úÖ Added to results: {primary_author} - Years: {years_found}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING EXTRACTED ARTICLES ===') print(f'Total rural Mexican history articles found: {len(rural_mexican_articles)}') if rural_mexican_articles: print('\n=== DETAILED RESULTS BY AUTHOR ===') # Group by author pansters_articles = [a for a in rural_mexican_articles if a['has_pansters']] ouweneel_articles = [a for a in rural_mexican_articles if a['has_ouweneel']] print(f'\nArticles by Wil G. Pansters: {len(pansters_articles)}') pansters_years = set() for i, article in enumerate(pansters_articles, 1): print(f' {i}. Title: {article["title"][:100]}...' if len(article['title']) > 100 else f' {i}. Title: {article["title"]}') print(f' Years: {article["publication_years"]}') print(f' Rural terms: {article["rural_terms_found"]}') pansters_years.update(article['publication_years']) print() print(f'Articles by Arij Ouweneel: {len(ouweneel_articles)}') ouweneel_years = set() for i, article in enumerate(ouweneel_articles, 1): print(f' {i}. Title: {article["title"][:100]}...' if len(article['title']) > 100 else f' {i}. Title: {article["title"]}') print(f' Years: {article["publication_years"]}') print(f' Rural terms: {article["rural_terms_found"]}') ouweneel_years.update(article['publication_years']) print() # Extract all unique years all_years = set() for article in rural_mexican_articles: all_years.update(article['publication_years']) print(f'=== FINAL PUBLICATION YEAR EXTRACTION ===') print(f'All publication years found: {sorted(list(all_years))}') print(f'Pansters publication years: {sorted(list(pansters_years))}') print(f'Ouweneel publication years: {sorted(list(ouweneel_years))}') # Save detailed results extraction_results = { 'extraction_objective': 'Extract publication years of Mexican rural history articles by Pansters and Ouweneel', 'search_criteria': 'Articles specifically about rural Mexican historical topics', 'total_articles_found': len(rural_mexican_articles), 'articles_by_pansters': len(pansters_articles), 'articles_by_ouweneel': len(ouweneel_articles), 'all_publication_years': sorted(list(all_years)), 'pansters_publication_years': sorted(list(pansters_years)), 'ouweneel_publication_years': sorted(list(ouweneel_years)), 'detailed_articles': rural_mexican_articles, 'source_file': detailed_file, 'extraction_timestamp': '2025-01-21' } results_file = 'workspace/mexican_rural_history_final_extraction.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úÖ RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final summary print(f'\nüéØ EXTRACTION SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total rural Mexican history articles: {len(rural_mexican_articles)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Articles by Pansters: {len(pansters_articles)} (Years: {sorted(list(pansters_years))})') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Articles by Ouweneel: {len(ouweneel_articles)} (Years: {sorted(list(ouweneel_years))})') print(f' ‚Ä¢ All publication years: {sorted(list(all_years))}') else: print('\n‚ö† No rural Mexican history articles found matching the criteria') print('Let me examine the results_by_category section for additional insights...') # Check the results_by_category section if 'results_by_category' in data: categories = data['results_by_category'] print(f'\nAvailable categories: {list(categories.keys())}') for category, results in categories.items(): if isinstance(results, list) and results: print(f'\n{category}: {len(results)} items') # Show first item as example if isinstance(results[0], dict): sample = results[0] print(f' Sample keys: {list(sample.keys())}') if 'title' in sample: print(f' Sample title: {sample["title"][:100]}...') # Check if this category has rural Mexican content sample_text = str(sample).lower() has_rural_sample = any(term in sample_text for term in ['rural', 'countryside', 'peasant', 'agrarian']) has_mexican_sample = 'mexican' in sample_text or 'mexico' in sample_text if has_rural_sample and has_mexican_sample: print(f' ‚úÖ This category contains rural Mexican content!') # Look at more items from this promising category print(f' Examining first 3 items from {category}:') for j, item in enumerate(results[:3], 1): if isinstance(item, dict): item_title = item.get('title', 'No title') item_has_pansters = item.get('has_pansters', False) item_has_ouweneel = item.get('has_ouweneel', False) print(f' {j}. {item_title[:80]}...') print(f' Authors: Pansters={item_has_pansters}, Ouweneel={item_has_ouweneel}') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON parsing error: {str(e)}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error analyzing file: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() else: print(f'‚ùå {detailed_file} not found in workspace') # List available files if os.path.exists('workspace'): print('\nAvailable files in workspace:') for file in sorted(os.listdir('workspace')): if file.endswith('.json'): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Development Plan #5
Plan Content:

Based on the comprehensive research data showing publication years spanning 1990-2009 for both authors' rural Mexican history articles, determine which specific year represents the article referenced in the TASK.
